subject: Re: [junit] how to compare two object
msgSnippet: ... If you are returning a value, then its class must implement equals() the way you would expect. I recommend you add the appropriate equals() method. If you
messageBody:
David Tsui wrote:

> Hi,I have some troubles in using Junit.
>
> many method's return value in our project are object,so the problem is
> how to use Junit to test such method?and espacial most of the variable
> in these objects are "private".

If you are returning a value, then its class must implement equals() the
way you would expect. I recommend you add the appropriate equals()
method. If you do, then it will not matter whether its properties are
private, because /it/ will compute equality with other objects.

Look at the Javadoc for Object.equals() for details.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
